name: pupa
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an insect in the stage of development after it has been a larva and before it becomes an adult, during which it is contained in and protected by a hard covering and does not move: a moth pupa mosquito pupae Compare
chrysalis
larva
Mathisa_s/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesIn ground beetles, a complete life cycle from egg to larva to pupa to adult takes one year.Fireflies survive in soil through the winter, turn into pupae in spring, then emerge in summer as winged adults. She monitors the butterflies as they emerge from their pupae.The picture shows a pupa case, where caterpillars transform themselves into moths.
